062BBB5D2281419BA48BCAC68E5FE7AE.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in construction technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, technical drawings, reports, photographs of projects, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

C16F91DAA0CF4E0CB8A8412888F33082.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the construction industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability);

405A6F052716459BB0511B8594A32953.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the construction industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., finding information, job task planning and organizing, measurement and calculation);

097AB885626F4525B87BF8B936796273.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the construction industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

B57647322ED14A5FA9B9AD1364BD02BB.description: explain the importance of lifelong learning for someone choosing a career in the construction industry;

0145471388044B5ABD9C8E489F213629.description: identify careers in the construction industry (e.g., construction craft worker, labourer, tradesperson, estimator, entrepreneur, interior designer, artisan), and describe the education and training required for these careers;

A4851E4734FD48F9912EF3A212A0F081.description: describe career opportunities in the construction industry, and explain the importance of lifelong learning in this field.

33F0C06ED4D04C5883D17CF2E5CA2F87.description: use protective clothing, gear, and equipment appropriately (e.g. dust mask, safety glasses, safety harness).

6C6725669A2C459FB5D20B2A7CD9F0E6.description: describe the rights and responsibilities of employees (e.g., the right to know, the right to refuse, the right to participate, as outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act);

00DF1B341B17483C9FA3381B87519294.description: use, handle, and store materials in accordance with Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) guidelines;

EEFFFF5FCC2A48EDBD01AD978706EBDC.description: identify and comply with health and safety legislation and practices for the construction industry (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB] regulations, provincial labour legislation, Ontario Building Code, local by-laws);

DD242405018846AA9F435DE53234CCF6.description: identify hazards related to construction materials, processes, tools, and equipment (e.g., toxic or flammable fumes from solvents, paints, varnishes, and gasoline; explosion or burns from propane; lung damage from silica; tripping or falls in unfinished buildings; shock from damaged power tools or electrical equipment), and the precautions that should be taken to avoid these hazards

AFF171DBD51D45BA964505725626F0AD.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and comply with health and safety regulations and practices specific to the construction industry;

3C79554099964410BB4773BE2E96AA65.description: identify the economic and social effects of the construction industry on a community or region (e.g., direct and indirect effects on employment, waste disposal, land use, water supply, Aboriginal land claims and traditional hunting).

A39B555DC0DD450BAE6EF92B948CE597.description: describe how features of residential buildings (e.g., halls, atriums, stairs, ramps) can affect the occupants’ quality of life;

ECE5E2C05B5D4478996EA1426AE8E102.description: identify how societal and client needs (e.g., budget constraints, barrier-free access, energy efficiency, cultural preferences) affect construction projects;

9D6A0D590E9A4455A19A69E24F4F4A04.description: Technology and Society: demonstrate an understanding of how society and the construction industry affect each other.

7E173A7BB9BB4F51B348DEC40D0FCEA9.description: research and identify sources and certifications for construction materials that have been manufactured using sustainable practices.

1B0DE77A5A664EF099BA915A99A829AB.description: identify programs provided by community partners and government agencies to reduce construction waste and to reuse or recycle construction materials (e.g., drywall, wood, refrigerants);

1AA7B7DA52FB45BAB1BEF55B0E94CC29.description: identify ways of reducing energy consumption in the home (e.g., heat recovery ventilator, tankless water heater, timers, energy-efficient lighting)

3E330B89440A40688D6199CA1E44F951.description: plan projects and processes to minimize waste (e.g., use efficient cutting patterns, reuse and recycle leftover materials);

8CF0B3E2A3F846C9B92FCDBA81008D1E.description: compare the efficiency and environmental effects of a variety of energy sources used in residential dwellings (e.g., solar, ground source, pellets, propane, wood, oil, natural gas, wind);

17F4B82C2E1F4240A49301159FA8FDCF.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of the environmental effects of construction projects, and ways of reducing harmful effects;

C5F33D2F0A014646B7B171113139EDC6.description: apply appropriate interior materials to finish construction projects (e.g., paint, tile, trim).

B080216F0D1C4F95B646D62ACD60E1E9.description: apply appropriate exterior materials to finish construction projects (e.g., vinyl or wood siding, fascia, soffits, brick veneer);

43DB88B671F94487905BC0C5E0876277.description: Finishing: apply various finishes to complete construction projects

28382E794EC6456CBCEF852A52A8D093.description: implement appropriate solutions for construction problems or challenges

228C06DBD0FE45D5985BAE0B684D9786.description: use a variety of appropriate techniques for levelling, plumbing, bracing, and squaring construction components;

EDC7DD6FEEA14FE0B19D949053D82680.description: install, test, and, if necessary, troubleshoot various systems of a construction project (e.g., electrical, plumbing, heating, masonry), ensuring that these systems comply with all applicable codes, regulations, and standards;

A50127A8175047A6A973C400B9716C66.description: construct or install components of projects according to working drawings, lists of materials and fixtures, and other design specifications (e.g., for roof pitch, masonry bond pattern, plumbing and electrical fixtures, tile patterns, mechanical system components, and electrical and structured wiring);

2402EAF2C49B49FB9A90E78BE54ECE88.description: Building and Assembly: demonstrate safe and accurate techniques for assembling construction projects;

1C0489E76ABB4C34969B0409FF5157A8.description: communicate construction information verbally and graphically (e.g., through written instructions, sketches, and/or detail drawings).

215715B028C443EC84FE73813EBDA955.description: use metric and imperial units correctly during the construction of a variety of projects;

861B9D9635484E5392FDF2ED72914DD8.description: lay out construction projects using a variety of tools and equipment (e.g., framing square, laser level, string line, plumb bob);

30C736FBA5A84166ADC228D93BF63B94.description: use, maintain, and store construction tools, equipment, and materials safely and correctly (e.g., tools: builder’s level, framing hammer, wire stripper, pliers, tri-square, trowel, pipe cutter, hand saw, reciprocating saw, masonry saw, circular saw, drill; equipment: air compressor, scaffolding, cement mixer, generator, electrical test meter; materials: lumber, sheet goods, plumbing materials, bricks, wiring);

602D1B7BED6741ABBCEF36942A7AEEA6.description: Technical Skills: demonstrate appropriate technical skills, including the safe use of construction tools, equipment, and materials;

835DC143D9F04A2D9DD500E122F4A31E.description: recommend modifications to a building project that would improve its quality and value (e.g., upgrades to insulation, air barrier, or HVAC system to reduce operating costs; use of more attractive or durable fixtures, trim, flooring, or exterior finish).

82ED3B619BF6412AAC446C9161C0573D.description: identify the relationships between structural and decorative elements in construction projects (e.g., studs, toe plates, and top plates provide secure support for baseboards and mouldings, which cover joints where walls meet floors and ceilings; masonry bond patterns provide strength and an attractive appearance) and incorporate these relationships into the planning and design of construction projects;

06129706D8694B34A9C34C052CB11D3E.description: identify the factors affecting foundation design (e.g., drainage, soils, frost penetration), and allow for these factors when planning and designing a construction project;

773CA8090BDB454FABAC9963A393CCB7.description: plan systems for construction projects (e.g., foundation, framing, roof, electrical, plumbing);

69613262985B4BECB5BBCD9312C1CC39.description: Building Systems: plan the installation of the systems for a building

EBEED52D45E34DB592654766DE93F4A2.description: describe the permit and inspection process required for various aspects of construction projects (e.g., building, electrical, plumbing, HVAC).

CFA0D1AD808B49BCABF44378A14CE0CB.description: use various resources to determine the requirements in codes, regulations, and standards that apply to construction projects (e.g., reference charts and tables; published codes, regulations, and standards; guides and trade manuals; government and association websites);

6260F9988B684925BD4DED3A5C78CE0C.description: identify the types of loads (e.g., live, dead) that building codes require residential structural members (e.g., footings, foundations, floors, bearing walls, roofs, columns, beams, lintels) to withstand;

7279169F1CC9463CB79E006331A06DEB.description: Codes, Regulations, and Standards: determine the requirements in building codes, regulations, and standards that apply to construction projects, and describe the permit and inspection process;

3F6487DEB08947759FDA3957244B7AEC.description: interpret working drawings to accurately lay out projects (e.g., determine dimensions and placement of footings, columns, openings, and beams; determine specified materials, size and type of windows and doors, masonry bond pattern, and locations of electrical, mechanical, and plumbing components).

A5C2FC584CC34CD39330270AC04F5E05.description: use working drawings to help plan the sequence of tasks for completing a construction project (e.g., excavation, footings, foundation walls, framing, sheathing, rough-in of mechanical systems, drywalling, installation of devices and fixtures);

094DDF4DDEEA46EE945C353F8CB2F074.description: create sketches and/or technical drawings (e.g., orthographic, isometric, plan, elevation, section, detail) of one or more building systems (e.g., structural, plumbing, electrical), using manual and/or computer-assisted methods and appropriate metric and/or imperial units;

2D4040707C434F2E95D2ECFE2786C877.description: Working Drawings: create and use working drawings for a variety of construction projects;

136AE3B4C6604055822737C97732CBF5.description: provide rationales for using particular materials for construction projects (e.g., asphalt shingles versus steel roofing, wood studs versus steel studs, block versus poured concrete, natural wood joists versus engineered joists).

DD1C6BA3F8D74C158AB7F710AF60AB58.description: identify the weather-related loads and stresses that a building must be designed to withstand (e.g., force of wind, snow load on roofs, expansion and contraction due to changes in temperature and humidity), and describe how these factors affect the planning and design of a construction project;

DEFAA80F8FE94D2592D77D6CDFBD4734.description: apply design principles (e.g., scale, proportion, contrast) when designing residential construction projects (e.g., kitchen layout, electrical layout, plumbing layout, mechanical layout, structural member layout);

6AC53FA0A14C40468C7EA00564DD53B9.description: use models, prototypes, and/or sketches to aid in improving the design for a project;

FF655CF63DD441F5B7A232B712D6F7CB.description: apply a design process and/or other problemsolving techniques to address construction technology challenges;

51891C838B534F248CD1D48D70297FC8.description: Design and Planning: apply a design process and/or other problem-solving processes and techniques as appropriate when planning a variety of residential construction projects, and demonstrate an understanding of factors that affect construction design;

48FE9C249CBE49C0975A3360BB3E1E26.description: demonstrate an understanding of scientific concepts (e.g., relationships among voltage, current, resistance, and power, and between wire size and current capacity; simple electron theory; methods of heat transfer) related to construction technology

4AD26403E2F14D3CB5340F54A2AB93B2.description: determine lengths and diameters of fastening devices needed to assemble various construction projects (e.g., lengths and gauges of screws, nails, and staples; diameters of dowels), using appropriate metric and/or imperial units;

6A81DB91FAC74656BF33230810164A69.description: estimate the quantities and costs of materials for construction projects, using appropriate metric and imperial units (e.g., metres, square metres, cubic metres, board feet, linear feet, square feet, cubic yards), and estimate the labour costs for these projects;

6E2CFABBA8F54CB2B2E62BF27EDADBA3.description: accurately calculate the layout and materials required for construction tasks (e.g., layout of open stair stringers, sizes of lintels, loads and wire gauges for electrical circuits, lengths and diameters of drain and vent pipes, duct sizes and lengths for residential heating/cooling systems);

087A111C03C44B44875289A54E8FD70E.description: convert between fractions and decimals, and between imperial and metric units (e.g., between feet and metres, between Fahrenheit and Celsius temperatures), using appropriate tables or charts;

7D1D3CA1409C4DEAA1B0DF4BAD477E83.description: Mathematical Skills and Scientific Concepts: apply mathematical skills and scientific concepts in the planning and building of a variety of construction projects.

D54D7B0D534242A18EEB9379A3DFEBDD.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe a variety of low-rise residential building styles (e.g., bungalow, two-storey, townhouse, side-split)

062BBEA9E0F14CA4AB50FAD3EF219780.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe construction tools and equipment (e.g., tools: builder’s level, framing hammer, wire stripper, pliers, tri-square, trowel, pipe cutter, hand saw, reciprocating saw, masonry saw, circular saw, drill; equipment: air compressor, scaffolding, cement mixer, generator, electrical test meter);

02A80C07FAC04814A9F0BBFDCF9202C9.description: use correct terminology to describe construction processes and techniques (e.g., processes: framing, levelling, squaring, making plumb; techniques: toe-nailing, shimming);

606B94BD663344998F305669B0D08608.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe construction materials (e.g., concrete forms, studs, lintels, ground-fault circuit interrupters, P-traps, plenums, medium-density fibreboard, plywood, cement, mortar);

AA3D43A13A294CB29F4953FF04C4CB49.description: identify safety standards that apply to construction projects (e.g., standards from the Occupational Health and Safety Act, the Canadian Standards Association [CSA], and the Technical Standards and Safety Authority).

F1A96843D1BA4979B098B8D0F6FA2E7E.description: identify other regulations that apply to the design of residential buildings (e.g., municipal by-laws, zoning, official plans, requirements for barrier-free access), and describe the process for obtaining construction permits;

3C70622F3DDB4E509F47FABD4313A952.description: describe the scope and purpose of the regulations (e.g., for framing members, built-up beams, electrical wiring, potable water piping, and drain, waste, and vent systems) in the codes that apply to building construction (e.g., Ontario BuildingCode, Ontario Electrical Safety Code, Ontario Fire Code);

F33F7F677A36454AA8F9202FA0DAB2A4.description: Codes, Regulations, and Standards: describe the scope and purpose of building codes, and identify other regulations and standards that apply to construction projects;

4AF477597B4B4C6498765F3A08880081.description: identify various construction processes (e.g., framing, casting concrete in place, bricklaying, tiling, installing millwork, insulating).

B2F93957450D4E09B8E36FEF31A78177.description: identify the materials and methods used to manufacture various construction components (e.g., wood studs, baseboard, moulding, steel beams, plastic pipe, armoured cable, windows, doors, paint);

2CE4D5B1A9BF455198A89F02F0DC102D.description: identify the components of the various systems in a building (e.g., structural: foundation, load-bearing wall, trusses, rafters; building envelope: air barrier, insulation, cladding or siding; electrical: service panel, conduit, cable, device boxes, fixtures);

21485987A6394BC3BAA13D833839D500.description: describe the properties (e.g., physical, mechanical, thermal) of natural and manufactured building materials (e.g., wood studs, steel studs, laminated beams, engineered floor joists);

0E9C52CBB19E4FEDAEED51B37B0396FA.description: identify building materials used in residential construction (e.g., natural wood, plywood, engineered wood products such as oriented-strand board [OSB], concrete, brick, adhesives, steel, copper, acrylonitrile butadene styrene [ABS], cross-linked polyethylene [PEX or XLPE], armoured and nonmetallic sheathed electrical cable);

9222959D99764D47933BD7C8499001F5.description: Materials, Components, and Processes: identify and describe a variety of construction materials, components, and processes;
